text: Brexit question: What’s the current situation with Northern Ireland (in practice). Earlier I saw lots of news about it, but nothing recent (this month).

elements.text: Brexit question: What’s the current situation with Northern Ireland (in practice). Earlier I saw lots of news about it, but nothing recent (this month).

text: it's still formally in the UK :smile:

elements.text: it's still formally in the UK

text: The BBC has a rough overview: <https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-northern-ireland-55488686>

attachments.title: Brexit: How Northern Ireland is different
attachments.text: From citizens' rights to trade, Northern Ireland will have a different Brexit to the rest of the UK.
attachments.fallback: BBC News: Brexit: How Northern Ireland is different

elements.text: The BBC has a rough overview:

text: Yeah, I was wondering where the border controls are. I’ll read that.

elements.text: Yeah, I was wondering where the border controls are. I’ll read that.

text: > But when entering Northern Ireland it is as if it is entering the EU.

elements.text: But when entering Northern Ireland it is as if it is entering the EU.

text: Ok, no tariffs in trade between GB and EU. Lots of paperwork for UK -> EU and UK -> Northern Ireland. No paperwork from Norther Ireland -> EU.

elements.text: Ok, no tariffs in trade between GB and EU. Lots of paperwork for UK -> EU and UK -> Northern Ireland. No paperwork from Norther Ireland -> EU.

text:
Recall the "No backstop" thing?
They kinda stopped calling it a backstop and it is now a thing

elements.text:
Recall the "No backstop" thing?
They kinda stopped calling it a backstop and it is now a thing

text:
But also as of today, these are now (at least theoretically) customs border controls between NI and the Republic.
Because the EU activated a emergency clause of the Withdrawal Agreement <https://www.theguardian.com/society/2021/jan/29/eu-moves-to-stop-northern-ireland-being-used-as-a-vaccine-backdoor-to-britain|https://www.theguardian.com/society/2021/jan/29/eu-moves-to-stop-northern-ireland-being-used-as-a-vaccine-backdoor-to-britain>

attachments.title: EU moves to stop Northern Ireland being used as a vaccine backdoor
attachments.text: Brussels triggers article 16 of NI protocol to put export controls on vaccine to the fury of Stormont
attachments.fallback: the Guardian: EU moves to stop Northern Ireland being used as a vaccine backdoor

elements.text:
But also as of today, these are now (at least theoretically) customs border controls between NI and the Republic.
Because the EU activated a emergency clause of the Withdrawal Agreement
